column4: Where should I start looking for a problem with gdm after upgrading to 10.10 64 bit desktop?
I don't look for problems,, problems just find me
I'm sure you must have tried but I would expect it would act as a usb disk and plug and play when you pluged it in
Yes, tried that. lsusb lists the phone but it's not mounted as a filesystem and also not recognized as a modem.
well in this case you don't need a modem,  sudo lshw not show the device have a driver?
Correct, no driver is loaded for the phone. It does work on a MS-Windows notebook, so I'm fairly confident the phone itself is functional.
dmesg records that the device was physically connected, but does NOT mention a specific driver being loaded or a device file being created.

well this phone worked back in 8.04, but I see people working it with tried adding the line usb-storage option_zero_cd=2   to /etc/modules  as seen here: http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-1145846.html  but didn't work for all people
Yup, that's the line I tried in my /etc/modules, but no joy.
I'm hesitant to upgrade this particular notebook to 10.10 just yet, because that upgrade broke GDM on my desktop.
no it worked before 8.04 or 8.10,  later it stoped working at 9.10....
Understood. There are also some comments on some of the bugs stating that the phone works again with some 10.10 systems.
newer is not always better is what I am tring to say
I hear you loud and clear.
don't blame you, I never upgrade till it's broken or there is some new software that no longer runs on mine without backports or is within 6 months of no longer being suported
